name: Malleshwaram Hogona
description:
This street art walk featuring 13 Indian artists and 12 artworks is an initiative by the Bengaluru Moving Campaign in association with the artist collective Geechugalu and several other partners to make the neighbourhood of Malleshwaram safe and friendly for women mobility. Gully Tours was the official partner to design the walking tour.What makes this tour specialWe’ll start this walk by relishing some legendary dosa at Shri Sagar CTR. From there we’ll visit the conservancy lanes that are adorned with art. We’ll explore the Malleshwaram market, seva sadan, sampige road, and end it at the BMTC bus stand.

Malleswaram is like a warm hug from a handmade shawl on a cold winter day. It’s a modern-day Malgudi with the goodness of history and the excitement of new-age quirks.

Street art captures the stories of people, their lives, and their neighbourhoods. Show some love to your local artists and let us go to Malleswaram.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.13 Indian artists came together to create 12 walls filled with art through the secret lanes of Malleswaram to reclaim spaces for pedestrians and women. The Malleswaram Hogona (Eng: Let’s go to Malleswaram) street art project wants to make streets safer for women. Conceived by the Bengaluru moving project, this street art walk is an initiative to make neighbourhoods safe, friendly, and full of character.

Apart from being one of the oldest planned neighbourhoods in the city, it houses a flower market, many institutions and lanes adorned with trees. Each work of art tells you the artist’s inspiration and their connection to the landscape, and we’d love to host you here.

Let’s go to Malleswaram to witness modern day murals painted on old world lanes, starting with a legendary breakfast at CTR.

name: Pete by Night
description:
Explore the evening vibe of the oldest neighbourhood of the city. While the business hubs thrive during the day, an insane food scene erupts at nightWhat makes this tour specialWe will start on Avenue Road, followed by pit stops at jewellery polishing shops, stroll through a 150 year old heritage structure and experience a different kind of nightlife comes alive here with the street food vendors, small businesses and shops. We will end the walk on Avenue Road at Rice Memorial.

This is the only walk that brings you the best of a local market, history, and street food in one.

Walk with us through the lanes of the ever-bustling Chickpete and understand the rich cultural and heritage history of the space.You can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Chickpete is popularly known as a bustling market. But did you know, it doubles up as a food street at night with carts serving everything from piping hot jalebis to pan-made badam milk?

Explore the evening vibe of the oldest neighbourhood of the city. While the business hubs thrive during the day, an insane food scene erupts at night, right in the heart of Bengaluru’s most thriving, busiest market.

Savour Bangalore’s best half pudi dosa, a secret vada pav joint straight from Maharashtra, patli jalebi on the cart, and the 365 day thandai service from the town’s best juice maker. This is the only walk that brings you the best of a marketplace, history, and street food in one.
